header: This week we have a handful of pretty nice Perl 6 tutorials, the releases of a few nifty projects, and the usual smattering of discussions, announcements and whatnots. Oh yeah, and this is (if you can believe it) the 250th edition of the Perl Weekly. Enjoy! ~ `/anick

entries.text: A few bug fixes, one more dev release, and (unless anything unexpected happens) the Age of Test2 is upon us.
entries.title: Test2/Test::Builder stable delayed to May 10th
entries.author: chad_granum

entries.text: The Sparrow project is reaching a stable point.
entries.title: Sparrow project highlights
entries.author: alexey_melezhik
yuki_kimoto
entries.title: GitPrep 2.0 is released -  Support pull request and add good features

entries.text: It's always nice what process and tools other CPAN authors use to craft and publish their distributions.
entries.title: Interlude 2, in which I write more about the release pipeline
entries.author: max_maischein
aristotle_pagaltzis
entries.title: The Coro situation
entries.text: So it seems Coro and Perl 5.22 aren't working well together. The reasons and history for that sorry state seem to be... complicated. Aristotle offers us a recap.

entries.author: curtis_ovid_poe
entries.text: A discussion on the classic theme of "things you can do but probably shouldn't unless you really, really like mobs, torches and pitchforks."
entries.title: Why I try to avoid Perl's punctuation variables

entries.text: A little time has passed, the dust has settled, and Neil takes a last look back on the 2016 edition of the QA Hackaton.
entries.title: QA Hackathon 2016 - a retrospective
entries.author: neil_bowers
dave_cross
entries.title: Training in Cluj -- The Poll
entries.text: Planning to go to YAPC::EU this summer? Intersted in training? You want to take this survey.
I think it is a truism that, given enough time, every developer will eventually come up with their how blog platform and template system. If you are an emacs user, this one might interest you.
entries.title: Blogging with org2blog
entries.author: steven_haryanto
yanick_champoux
entries.text: A small script helping to bring colors to log listings.
entries.title: Groom that yak
There Are Traitors In Our Midst!
entries.text: No, no need to panic. Malicious moles haven't been discovered living amongst us. This is merely a (very nice) introduction to Perl 6 traits.
entries.author: zoffix_znet

entries.title: Brutally Solving a Logic Puzzle with Perl 6
entries.text: Built-in "is-prime" method, set operators, list manipulations. No doubt, Perl 6 is nicely suited for dealing with math problems and puzzles.

entries.author: miguel_prz
entries.title: NICEPERL's lists
entries.text: Miguel Prz (NICEPERL)'s regular lists: Great modules released last week; MetaCPAN weekly report; StackOverflow Perl report.

subject: Brutal butterfly on the loose, Math puzzle placed under protective custody
